Key Match Events: The Braves blew a late four-run lead but rallied for four more runs in the 10th inning to beat the Twins, 8-6.
Michael Harris II hit a two-run homer in the second inning.
Marcell Ozuna hit a two-run single in the fifth inning.
Trevor Larnach tied the game with a looping liner in the eighth inning.
Raisel Iglesias turned his first blown save since May 3 into a victory by pitching a 1-2-3 ninth inning.
Travis d'Arnaud logged an RBI single in the four-run 10th inning.
Ramón Laureano hit a two-run double in the 10th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Brian Snitker commented, 'That’s a good win. It was going to be a costly loss, quite honestly. Now, it’s a good win.'

Travis d’Arnaud said, 'We knew we were getting some heat, and were able to fight off the good offspeed pitches, too. Just competitive at-bats throughout. I think everybody felt bad that we gave up the lead and wanted to make sure we ended with a win.'
Marcell Ozuna praised d'Arnaud, saying, 'He’s a clutch hitter. Every time he’s got the situation in that spot, he’ll do something. He’ll do some damage.'
Ozuna also reflected, 'We always play the game like a playoff [matchup]. We always build and prepare for what’s next coming up.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves have now won eight of their last 10 games.
The Braves have four extra-inning wins in the month of August.
Travis d’Arnaud has driven in runs in the 10th inning in three of those extra-inning wins.
